column6: I haven't been here since pre Covid. So happy they're still around, a staple for this neighborhood. What I love about them is their consistency and service. Definitely try them out for food or lunch. It's kind giving Latin diner vibes, but unique as the food is actually good as are the drinks.

I have been here a few times but I have not been here in a while , I was excited to go back because I remember they had great food and drinks. They have a great atmosphere and fun music. The service was so bad I can't even believe how bad it was.... We got there and it took a very long time to even have someone ask if we wanted drinks but finally we placed a drink order and said we just needed a few more minutes to decide on the food ... we got the drinks after a very long wait and no one came back to take an order.... An hour after catching up with my friends and finishing our drinks we realized we had been there an hour and still no one took our order ( no it was not very busy )  finally we asked someone to send out waiter over and he took the order and we ordered another round of drinks .... Again a very long wait until we had to get up and ask someone if we could get our drinks ..... one of the items ordered were peanut butter and jelly waffles that was supongo have banana cream on it ... when we asked someone the waiter came back and we told him this is missing the banana cream and a few min later they brought extra peanut butter and jelly and just put it on the table and walked away, I am so disappointed because I recommended this place and it definitely did not live up to my expectations... I can't say the service was ever superb but it was never this bad I have to be honest I don't think I will be going back again any time soon

Very Solid Cuban. Great quality pork in the Cuban sandwiches & all around. Amazing that they are open so late but be ready for a bit of a wait. The desserts looked very good too but i was way too full.
Delightful 24/7 cuban/LATAM bar and diner. Pretty solid food for not too much and open whenever you need it.

I stumbled upon this place looking for late night eats!! And let me tell you, I was so glad I did! I had to bring my friends JUST so they could experience the oxtail empanada! Everyone was very pleased with their meals and cocktails! This will be our new weekend hangout!!

Food was ok but expensive for the portions. Had half a Cuban sandwich for $14. Such a small sandwich and really just a slice of ham, mustard, pickles and some pork. Not worth it in my opinion. The other dish was some tortilla and cheese and that was about $15. Totally overpriced.

Such a cute and welcoming place! It's extremely busy, which can only mean one thing! People love it! I happen to be in the area and walked in, so glad I did! The food was delicious! Drinks were on point, and lots of yummy options. I removed a star due to the service, waiters take a bit to come around. But overall I really enjoyed this place and if I'm ever in the area I will for definitely return.

When you need filling food st 3am, this is a great option, open 24 hours.  Staff is friendly and the food is good. My wife and I shared a Cuban sandwich, which was very flavorful. The bread was a little too hard, but since our visit was at an ODD hour, I'll take what's available. The ambience is up lifting. The mojito was good but the caipirinha was average.
The oxtail empanadas are the best! I love it. It's my favorite! I always recommend them to friends!

Why didn't someone tell me they had a 24hr food spot that is sooo good! Delicious food here at Coppelia especially if you hungry at 3 am. They have Latin style / American menu and literally everything is good!

Ordered take out from this place. The food was delicious, certainly more fatty than expected. The flavors in the dishes I got were more on the sweet side, assuming it was the peppers. I like the food that I ordered, if i was in the mood for a more sweet, less savory dish, I'd know exactly where to go. Everything was made well and presented well. No complaints here!

I went late night, the waiter was accommodating and consistently checked on us. The decor was all right wasn't something that I spent much time focusing on but I really enjoyed the Latin feel to it. The FOOD WAS GREAT AND FULLING. Definitely enjoyed and would give it a 8/10!

A 24 hour place to get nachos! We ordered the beef short rib nachos, which came adorned with nacho cheese sauce, guacamole, refried black beans, sour cream, and salsa. The tortilla chips tasted like they were made in house and had a perfect amount of salt to them. They were also a bit thicker than the average grocery store tortilla chip, which I appreciated! Our server also had a very upbeat attitude and was clearly excited to share his passion for the food and culture with his customers.

It is one of my favorite Latin food restaurants, the customer service is excellent but I think the bathroom should be remodeled, it looks old, it is rusty and with the marks it has it should be painted, it is the only bathroom in the restaurant so I recommend maintenance, otherwise there is nothing bad to say.
Excellent service, great and authentic food that is served 24 hours a day. I have returned multiple times and have not been disappointed!

Lovely Cuban sandwich and drinks. Media noche is another fave. The octopus and chorizo sandwich is one of the most unique I've ever had. The yuca fries + mojo are a perfect combo. I can't believe this place is 24/7

Been here many times over the years. It's a decent spot for late night pan-latin fare, but, echoing a lot of the recent reviews -- the way they treat guests has gotten out of hand. I was waiting on my friend to use the restroom after we'd paid our check, and the bouncer (yeah, they have a bouncer at night) told me I had to wait outside. When I told him I was just waiting for my friend, he said "who's your friend?". Not sure what name he was expecting, not sure why it matters. Why are they acting like it's a nightclub?
This is my and my friend's go to place. Convenient location, phenomenal Cuban food, ambiance gives a cozy feel. Typically packed so keep that in mind. Fun bartenders, nice staff.

Speedy service and great food! Kinda a diner vibe. The empanada was my favorite item from there! The plantain complimented the meat flavor so well and the toppings were so good as well. The pulpo sandwich was pretty good and would be better with some hot sauce. The burger was also pretty good but my favorite was definitely the empanada. Really friendly service as well!

As someone from South Florida going to Cuban restaurant in NYC seemed wrong.  But Coppelia delivers in atmosphere and in the food. It has a festive  feel and the servers were chill.  Food is a very good value for the price.
Food was absolutely amazing! I had Pernil and spicy kale which was oh so yummy! I would definitely recommend and go back to try other items on their menu.

Did not know what to expect, and so glad I came.  My youngest has learned about it and recommended it.  Well, the service, variety of food and ambience was great.  For being in Manhattan, it also was very reasonable with prices and portions.  I would recommend it for casual fun and great service!

Our go to Cuban/Latin restaurant when visiting family in the city. Place is always busy but tables turn over pretty fast. But I'm here to tell you about the short rib and mofongo dish they have. To tell you it's the best thing I have ever eaten would be an understatement. As a proud Boricua this dish makes me happy. The perfect, rich short rib coupled with their tasty mofongo is a marriage made in food heaven. This was a special that is now permanently on the menu. My sister in law had the Lomo Saltado and it also sent my eyes rolling into the back of my fat head. The service is excellent and prices are very reasonable for a place in the Village/Chelsea. I'll be back over and over again. You should pay this place a visit!!!

Absolutely Not! The "Bouncers"'at the front door told us "no one fucking told you to come here" when we questions a group being seated before us, after we waited 25+'mins! They were extremely rude, and when we asked for a manager, we were told "don't worry about talking to anyone"'! My wife asked to use the bathroom while waiting and the bouncer tried to use intimidation tactics as if we were going to back off from seeking leadership help! I'm glad we walked away and saved our money! And I will never attempt this establishment again!

Oxtail empanada was so amazing from the sweetness of the plantain dough to the heartiness of braised oxtail.(A little more oxtail would have been in my favor considering the sweetness of plantain) Definitely wish there was a "s" behind the word empanada ! Now the Lomo saltado was was a fatty fat dream. Fatty short ribs dropping all of it's natural flavor in the pan and getting toss around in a pan with the soy sauce, ginger, fries, red onion, etc. was a perfect choice of cooking style!!
Great atmosphere food and drinks :) our server was very fun and friendly. It's on the pricier side but worth it. would definitely go again!

This place is my mother fucken SPOT. I probs go here like once a week; the waiters call me and my friends the tequila girls. The food is bomb - I luv the flautas, nachos, chicken noodle soup, Cesar salad, Mac n chicharrón. The bar tender Humberto is super hot. Literally the best place to go at any hour.

3 of us went at 1pm on a Wednesday and the place was jumping with maybe the "lunch" crowd? It took awhile before one of the two waiters attended to us but the wait was well worth it. First note: being in NYC the parking or driving is not recommended, being short staffed was not an issue as we had a lot of catching up with friends. Ropa Vieja was my favorite (see menu pic) but sadly it did not come with fried banana and had to be ordered separately. All our dishes were excellent and with leftovers, another meal was forthcoming. Definitely will go back and bring friends. You will not be disappointed.
The food was delicious, the service excellent, everything was sanitary. We're definitely coming back!

So good! We got into the city late after a delayed flight and needed somewhere to eat late. We wanted to eat at a restaurant and luckily found Coppelia! The food and vibe are so great! Everyone who works there was super nice too.

This spot is pretty cool my friend was telling me about it for a while and I finally gave it a try. I had the hash de costillla and it was delicious !!! Definitely worth trying . Also good vibes and good decor !! Pull up if you wana have a great time !

My friends and I dined here the other night, we were seated in back by the kitchen. It was going well, we received our food and it was pretty good. However wait staff was rushing by and food was spilled on me. It was a thick white garlic sauce. It spilled on my dry clean only sweater and my coat. The waiter who spilled it helped clean my coat and was very apologetic. When we told our waiter what happened he was not very eager to make anything right. He spoke to his manager and the best they could do was free dessert. The man who spilled the food offered to pay for my dry cleaning but I am disappointed in how the restaurant management chose to handle this situation or rather lack there of. I understand that mistakes happen but the customer service my friends and I were shown here was terrible. I will never return.

Came here after a night out just cause it was open 24/7 and was pleasantly surprised! They have an extensive menu full of items you definitely want to eat while drunk lol. I had the mac and chicharron which was good (cannot comment on much else bc I wolfed it down and was not sober) and satisfied my cravings. The staff was also very accommodating for our large group. I'd come back here again if I was in the area!
New Yorks hottest club is Coppelia our shining beacon of 24hour hope  short rib nachos or die
Waitress was super attentive and quick! Food was great, there was a green sauce that added a nice touch to my dish. Went to this place with my friends and they also enjoyed the service here as well
Best veggie burger in the city hands down. Great atmosphere and energy, great food, great service. My favorite place to take anyone who visits me.

To me this is what a New York dining experience should be if you want a cafe.  Coppelia is a very inviting cafe with a Cuban twist.  I ordered the chicken and rice bowl and found the spices to mix very well.  The price was very reasonable by New York City standards.  Good food and atmosphere at a reasonable price cannot be beat.

Surprisingly good food late night. Splits tabs by cards. I'll never come here and not order the Margarita Cubana -- worth the visit for that itself. The caipirinha's were unanimous by the others in my party.
Amazing food, really good service. The corn on the cob was the best I've ever had but nothing can beat the cubano sandwich. Reasonable priced too!

Im a hungry vegetarian I find things to eat here. I strongly recommend this place and in a Friday night it's very busy. I want to give kudos step I drop my earring and one staff member found me around the corner to give me my earring. For that alone this place gets five stars.

Nice spot!! I came here at like 3am and there were a decent amount of people for sure. The food was well seasoned and was so so sooooo good. They have traditional Cuban dishes as well as new interesting stuff. The arroz con pollo my friends ordered was a tad salty and that says a lot since I love salt but the ropa vieja I got was incredible. Definitely recommend.

Get the Fish tacos and some Tres Leches cake! Those tacos appetizer were delicious. They had a smoky flavor even though they were fried (flounder) not grilled. I'm not sure how they got the smoky flavor in it but those were tasty. We got guacamole and it comes with tortilla,sweet potato and plantain chips. Guacamole could have been fresher but on a Sunday night in a 24hr restaurant I guess it was made earlier for the brunch service. I had Salmon and purple mashed potatoes as main course. The salmon is fine, I recommend getting it medium rare. The purple mashed potatoes are glutinous so I'd get a side to go with it next time. They have nice sides of yuca fries, sweet potatoes fries , maduros or rice and beans or others for $5 . Get a couple for the table with your mains .My friend got the house Burger with sweet potato fries. They'll bring a caddy of sauces out if you ask . That burger is a lot to eat and a bit messy!. So be warned - you may have to deconstruct it . But my friend finished it and liked it. For drinks we got the Margarita Cubano which is delicious with tamarind puree and tangy salt rim . Get this. My friend had the Hemingway Royal with rum Bacardi and ginger syrup and Cava. He liked it but I thought it was more a Summer drink being light and refreshing. Next round I got Atrevido which is really smoky mezcal with pineapple and strawberry puree. Be warned - it's very smoky so if that's your thing you'll like it. My friend got Guarapita with rum, passion fruit, strawberry and cucumber and this was delightful. Get one. Get Tres Leches cake for dessert in a little glass , it has a nice cinnamon flavor and cream. Ask to sit in the back in a booth if you can. They don't take reservations and it's a popular spot in Chelsea. Staff were really nice and extra good review for the bartender! Nice casual spot .

Coppelia has the feel of a diner, with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. I tried the Lomo Saltado which was delicious - super flavorful and the meat was so tender, honestly one of the best versions I've had in the city. Service was also great, and we didn't have to wait long before getting our food.
Love this place. Great food and late night kitchen. Service is always great. Brunch is awesome as well.
Great food! Awesome service. Fun place to vibe out and enjoy great music, second time back

When we arrived around 5pm (because we had a 4-year-old with us), it was already packed.  Service is fast and courteous. Excellent dishes from all over the Hispanic universe. Authentic guacamole (unspoiled with lime juice or anything similar), great mac & cheese, and everybody enjoyed their entrees -- Cuban sandwich, chile relleno (vegetarian version), and skirt steak.  No reservations accepted, so plan accordingly.

Obviously a very popular place. Good HAPPY HOUR too. We've been here several times now. The service is excellent and friendly I think the food is good. The mixed drinks seem to be high on the favorite list here. I think the food is a bit overpriced for what it is. It's good. It would just be better for a couple bucks less. The Chili Relleno was not very good. Plus on saturday night the noise level is incredible. We were hoarse when we left from yelling to be heard.
Reliable, creative, delicious Latino diner food. Worth a visit! These are more characters for no reason.

If you want to find good food in NYC, ask the bartenders. Coppelia was recommended to us, and it did not disappoint. Great Cuban food, and even though it was shoulder to shoulder packed, the service was top notch!!!!
Was a good environment just the giro said 15-20 min wait n never slaked us we went back in 46-1 he n saw they were sitting people so the girl forgot us but overall food and drinks good

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

column6: Best cubano I've ever had! The bread is super crispy. My friend ordeeed the lomo saltado and it was sooo good too. The steak was like BUTTAH! Definitely will come back!

I love this place.  FANTASTIC breakfasts.  Cheap and delicious and the coffee never stops.  Lunch and dinner are great menus too and the drinks are amazing.  I once went, before Covid, to a Cuban passover dinner.  My grandmother would have loved it.

Whenever I need a good spot to eat that's open 24 hrs 7 days a week this is my go to spot the empanadas are to die for the roast pork it amazing and the Cubans is one of my fav sandwiches to get from here the service is great also
Poor customer service. They have a favorite system, fiends of friends and no reservation system.
My go to spot for Cuban in the city. The service is impeccable and always have the nicest staff. If you need a quick place to go or have a date to plan, Coppelia is your place.

I was looking for a late night spot to grab food and I came across this gem . It's open 24 hours ! Perfect for before or after the club since most kitchens close at 10pm. The menu is filled with Cuban and other Latin style dishes . They also have a 24 hour breakfast menu . They have a little bit of everything on the menu from quesadillas to soups , sandwiches and dinner entrees and also desserts. The service is very fast as well . I ordered a beef empanada as an appetizer and it was extremely delicious. The crust was nice and crispy while the inside was warm and gooey . The ground beef was seasoned well and had a little bit of green olives. It came with a chimichurri flavored sauce . For an entree , I ordered the Lomo Saltado and omg ... the meat was so tender and juicy and the sauce was savory and rich. My only complaint was that the white rice was a little undercooked but I still couldn't stop eating it . I definitely recommend trying this place if you're looking for Latin cuisine or if you need a late night pick me up .

Coppelia is an Italian restaurant with a flare of great service and food. It reminds me of the old restaurants in Italy, the staff are very knowledgeable about the dishes and you will leave the restaurant joyfully stuffed. I'm lucky to have this establishment right in my backyard so I don't have to travel to little Italy in the Bronx or near Canal Street. Please go with your family and enjoy family style dishes

I was surprised at how delicious there food was. I ate there twice and the service was great. Everything on the menu had such reasonable prices.  As I love chicken soup, theirs was possibly the best I ever had. Very clean restaurant and cozy atmosphere. I can't wait to stop by again next time I am in the city.

Our second time to Coppelia and we loved it just as much. Great ambiance, super good food (corncob, huevos rancheros, lemon ricotta pancakes) and friendly service. I appreciated the strong drinks  and the Covid protocol was good.
Get the Lomo Saltado; you will not be disappointed. Loved that this place was open 24/7 when we were hungry after a long day of exploring New York. Friendly staff and very clean place.
My go to when it's late and diner fare won't do. Coppelia is the place fAn excellent alternative to late night diners if you like Cuban food.  A bit pricey but worth it.

Before going back home from dinner, my friend just want to stop one more place so that is why we come to Coppelia. Even it is close to closing time but they still have a lot of customers and busy. At the bar I have Gran Paloma, I like the taste of passion fruit, grapefruit and lime. I love fruity drink ;) my friend has her favorite Hendricks as usual. Service is good and bartender is very friendly. Because my friend already has lots of drinks tonight, we can't stay long so we will come back here next time.

The warm greeting from the hostess at the door was the first hint that Coppelia was a special place. A perfect corner booth, lively Cuban music playing, friendly waitstaff and incredibly delicious food justified our first impression. Open 24/7, no reservations taken but worth the wait if busy. Enjoy!

I've introduced this place to half a dozen friends with varied tastes, and they all liked it. Better yet, it's open 24/7. It can get loud at times. I love the fish tacos for starters. The oxtail and the pernil are very good. Save room for fresh churros.

Number one breakfast spot for me and my beau. Pedro is the best!! Love Jennifer as well. I've tried almost everything on their breakfast menu that's vegetarian and it all tastes amazing. More than anything the staff is so attentive and caring. We always feel so taken care of here

A little taste of Miami in NYC. This Cuban style diner hits the spot. Come here to get a churrasco steak covered in chimmichuri  sauce atop a bed of  rice, beans and platanos. The steak was cooked perfectly!! It even came with a little Brussel sprout salad and some cojito cheese. Make sure to ask for the avocado sauce on the side, you won't regret ir!! I was pleasantly surprised with the portion. My mezcal cocktail paired perfectly with my dish. Will definitely return!

My friend and I came to this place after a show so it was pretty late, but that did not matter. We ordered the Mac and cheese chicharrón, vuelve a la vida to start then we had the churrasco and enchiladas suizas as the main course. We ended the meal with a tres leche and flan. We were so happy with our choices. The ambiance was on point, the food was delicious and the staff were so friendly. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and service.

Wow wow wow! What a great place to visit while in Chelsea. We all ordered different things and all ate every bite. I loved the decorations and the feel of the restaurant as well. The staff was great and helpful with the menu. The cocktails were wonderful as well. I had a little buzz off of one of the the margaritas... spicy of course! It's just a small place but definitely worth the stop! I would go back!

Horrible customer service!!!! Food was good again but!!!!! The service was really bad.   I hate going somewhere twice in two weeks.   Still getting bad service!   I definitely will not be returning even it's the last place to eat!!! If you don't look like money don't bother.   Can't go to this place looking like a normal person.   SMH prices were different from last week till this week too...

Is it so much to ask when you appear at a casual restaurant in NYC,  a diner specifically, that you're greeted, sat, and asked if you want coffee and water? I arrived at Coppelia perhaps 5 minutes prior to my companion. The restaurant was not even 1/4 filled. When I walked in, there was no acknowledgment. I asked if I could sit down, and I was met with the attitude of "When will your party arrive?" Huh? It's a diner. Anyhow, the man was leading me towards the rear passing a large booth, I asked if we could sit there, and I was met with more attitude but I was given the privilege nonetheless. My friend finally arrived, and we chatted for a long few minutes before a server appeared with menus, no greeting, and did not offer anything. He came back, and gave my friend a hard time over a very basic order of eggs and bacon? When I ordered coffee, he was almost insulted as he said, "What kind? We have cafe con leche, latte, cappuccino, espresso, or americano?" Again, it's a NEW YORK DINER, just bring a mug of freshly brewed hopefully good coffee, ok? Then we waited again before said drinks appeared. The coffee was fine, the food was poor. The chilaquiles were a tasteless homogenized mess, with no differentiation in the flavors and textures. I asked for hot sauce. The food runner brought a fiery green hot concoction that I mistakenly poured over my food, deeming it, inedible. Stupid me, I expected when asking for hot sauce in most restaurants as such, getting Tobasco, or at least be forewarned. I took one bite and I had to blow my nose. If I'd not been on my way to work, I'd of complained but we just paid and left. Was it what we ordered? A bad time to be there? Maybe breakfast isn't their thing? Or they should not be open 24 hours so they can gather their bearings between shifts? I don't know but I don't have any reason to return anytime soon.
Every bite was a hit! I had the Coppelia smash as my drink, a beef empanada and the chicken enchiladas! I can't wait to go again and bring friends too. This place is a gem.

I got the churrasco! So good, cooked perfectly and very flavorful. Apparently this place is open 24/7? The portions are huge -- you could for sure share this. All very good quality I will definitely come back
Good service good great drinks I have Hendricks bartender gives me very good drinks very good Hendricks very strong drink I love service.

I've come to Coppelia a number of times over several years and it's a hit every time. The highlights for me have always been the Lomo Saltado and the Ropa Vieja, two consistently delicious meals that I can't recommend enough. The meals are all filling and I leave stuffed every time. This is another place that I love bringing friends to, it has a little bit for everyone. Plus, it's open 24 hours and has all day breakfast! What else do you need?

Been here a few times now! The drinks are reasonably priced and delicious! Also 10/10 recommend the oxtail empanadas!! I've had the Mac n cheese app and tbh it was pretty disappointing, tasted like Kraft Mac n cheese. The nacho apps with short rib are delicious and the Chile releno is also amazing!!

Good food but poor service. Visit this restaurant Frequently but poor service. Couple of missed steps with first the waiter arriving a couple of minutes too long after being seeing to start taking an order, then missed bringing a side that was ordered. After that literally waiter had a blind eye to our table we called someone else to acknowledge us to order a second round of drinks. Thinking he will get the hint noo someone else came to ask if we're done and have our plate to go while our waiter is just talking to coworkers at the bar. Waited for dessert and then we just called on a lady who was very helpful and explained what's going on and she was attentive for what was left of our time there. Fix the service! Food was spot on no complaints. Will be there again to see if this is a one off or happening again.

Super, super delicious food at Coppelia! The lomo saltado honestly blew me away, and the happy hour margarita special for $8 was great. We will definitely be frequenting this restaurant for its decent prices and really yummy food!

This place is sooooo good! I got a passion fruit mojito which was refreshing and delicious, but the real star of the night was the Lomo Saltado! The flavor was incredible and the meat was so tender it was like butter! You have to get it if you come here.
Excellent service, food quality, and atmosphere. One of my favorite food experiences in NYC. The management, cooks, and wait staff make an overall great spot for food and drinks at all hours.
Went back today am I am delighted to say that the food is still primo and the staff as pleasant and gorgeous as ever. This place rocks (salsas).

I had such an excellent meal here and so did my dining partner. I had skirt steak, and it was perfectly cooked. Served with a mixture of black beans and rice, perfectly cooked plantains. (They were kind of crispy on the outside and yummy soft on the inside) and sautéed brussels sprouts with a kind of Mexican cheese, grated on top of it, frankly, for $28 I thought it was a steal. It was a really nice size healthy, serving of steak and cooked perfectly. I am pretty picky about medium rare or rare and the waiter made the effort to make sure it was perfect. I had a nice glass of red wine, a large pour for a change! and my dining partner had the Lomo Saltado. No appetizers and we were stuffed.! I could not help noticing the amazing desserts that we're going by and in the dessert case, and I found out they now have their own pastry chef. I have to say they may have had their struggles getting staff at the tail end of the pandemic, but we gave her another chance and I am so glad we did because this will be on my favorites rotation! I'm looking forward to going back and trying some of the great looking cocktails and definitely dessert. Our waiter could not have been nicer, and I complemented the manager on how everything has really come together, and she also was incredibly gracious. I've gotten tired of so many restaurants that have an attitude, are expensive and give you a tiny serving of precious food. This is not one of them!
Wow this was such an amazing experience. Food was soo damn good! Flavors tasted like my mom cooked for me! That's a compliment! Staff is nice and they are safe during pandemic!!

Came here for lunch on the weekend, had to wait a bit for a seat but we got to enjoy the outdoor seating for our meal. The hostess was very friendly and offered recommendations. I got each of the empanadas - beef, chicken, and cheese and corn. The beef was absolutely delicious and would order again. Would come again!

Returned with a big group and had a great experience. The hash was amazing - definitely going to get that again. Pancakes with mango were also decent, but the blue corn pancakes are better, so I'll stick to those. My boyfriend liked his mojito, and I had a delicious fresh passionfruit juice. We also got some complimentary cookies for the table, which was a nice touch!
By far one if the most consistent places to eat in Manhattan. Th food is remarkable and the service is always impeccable. Oh you gotta try the cocktails too, particularly the Gran Paloma/GRANDE.

Man are these guys fast!! Excellent service, an excellent Spicy Bloody Mary. I the Cuban Benedict which very fast and hot with a side of Brussel sprouts. Service was very friendly. Prepare for a wait for a table but so worth it! Yum!!

We got the oxtail empanada as a snack and it was very tasty! It was different than what I thought - the meat was inside plantain and garnish with white cheese and red onions. The only thing was that the oxtail was grounded which made it taste more like regular ground beef. Could also have been a little spicier to help counteract the sweetness of the plantain - so eat it was another item and not by itself if anyone is sensitive to sweet :).

I have to start with the customer service. There are very attentive and extremely nice. They are always ready to take your order and make suggestions on what is good on the menu(everything is good) happy hour Sunday threw Thursday. Breakfast is survived all day! There dinner there appetizers are great! What more can I say about this place. I have tried many other places around this area. Not one of them can even stand close to Coppelia! I just found out they will be 24/7! If you want to take family or friends somewhere nice with really good food with great service and a price to match! Take them here! I promise you won't be disappointed.

This is the best fucking food I've ever had in my life. I never write reviews and I'm now writing this while eating my food. Get the Lomo Saltado but make sure to drink some Gran Paloma with it. Holy shit man.

I was so glad when Coppelia was back open and running I used to love this place Pre-COVID but my last visit there was EXTREMELY disappointing. My friend and I ordered salads for a light lunch and were rudely handled when they came and the order was incorrect. They served my friend a completely wrong salad and mine had the wrong protein on the salad. Once our order was corrected it looked as though they had just picked the chicken off my salad and replaced it with shrimp because there were left over pieces of chicken. The lettuce  in both of the "new" salad were DRENCHED in water and there was hardly any dressing, they basically served us Caesar salad soup.  Im very disappointed with the service and the food quality.

i walk in to this restaurant expecting well done cuban cuisine and i was sadly mistaken.My husband and i order the ropa vieja and rabo encendido there was no flavor no seasoning i was very much disappointed i couldn't believe that if I a latin American would expect something a little better from a cuban restaurant to have some zest of flavor no i was mistaken. My husband complain the whole time that the food taste burnt and it was bland. never again will i come here . other than that the server was perfect and so was the drinks.

The food was absolutely amazing and we had the nicest waitress Fiorela, who was completely amazing and very attentive. I ordered the Torta de Milanesa with some spicy fries on the side and used my yelp cupon for a free drink. My friend ordered a Cuban burger and she fell in love with it too. One thing I find odd is how people say it's a Cuban place, considering there menu is vast and offers things from other countries as well it's not just Cuban it's more of a Latin mix.

Let me start off by saying the outdoor seating was really nice and there's a good amount of spacing between the tables. The server was really sweet, and the experience in general was very pleasing. My only complaint is the food was mediocre. I ordered Arroz con Pollo and Rojo Vieja, for both dishes, parts of the rice were undercooked/hard. The arroz con pollo was good, but tasted like Chinese stir fry..the ropa vieja was okay. Definitely wished it came with a side of greens, maybe avocado? Overall it was a decent experience
Love this place. Easy and casual. Everything is delicious and they have deals on mojitos and other drinks. Very reasonably priced.

Coppelia is a cute brunch spot. With excellent service and food. I had the Pepito- an amazing steak sandwich with bacon, sweet corn, gouda and shoestring potatoes. The combination of all those ingredients created a truly amazing sandwich beefy but slightly sweet with a little garlic and the potatoes for some crunch. It's a pretty big sandwich but I wasn't complaining. I also had their yucca fries which were thick and crisp. Ohh the sauce for the yucca fries was what I loved most. It was sone kind of basil/herb vinagrette-excellent. Their menu choices were pretty diverse and I'd go back to try other things on the menu. Plus their proces were reasonable for good food

Nice large diner. Came here to get breakfast for dinner and had the eggs coppelia. Food was good, not super imaginative but a solid option where you know what you're getting. Tasty and well presented. Came out really quick too, service was good, they turned us around quickly but there wasn't a feeling of being rushed. They let me sit at the bar for a while to wait for my friend with no pressure either. Overall good experience and I'll be back if in the area

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Made a point to travel across town to try this place for dinner with a friend from out of town. It did not disappoint! Lovely ambiance, delicious food, and great service. Diner style but with a Cuban twist. I had the Cubano -- classic Cuban sandwich -- which was scrumptious, with an excellent house flan for dessert. Quality, not quantity is the name of the game here.

Fantastic kick ass lomo saltado. It's sooo good there is a solid chance you will come back for it. Scrumptious. Lovely place that is low key and casual but still cool enough to take your date or friends to. I'll definitely be back.

would leave 5 stars if the waiter wasn't coming by every 15 minutes asking "want to order anything else?". I wasn't there for more than an hour and a half, they must've checked in about 6 times. we ordered 3 coffees, 3 items from the brunch menu, and 4 appetizers all at once. everything was good!
The food was immaculate I had the chicken flautas and they were so crunchy and juicy. I also had the steak and it was so amazing.
one of my favorite lunch spots in the chelsea area. Their avocado cesar salad is delicious! Today I ordered the metador to drink. it has a kick to it so if you enjoy spice you will love this drink.

Overall, a really great spot for Cuban food! It had a very Mom & Pop feel to it and the staff was very friendly and helpful! There was a bit of a wait to get served but it was around lunch time so it was not a big deal. The frito de mar was amazing and the sauce was so tasty we asked for more. It was a passion fruit sauce that was slightly sweet. The spicy fries were wonderful and well seasoned. The arroz con pollo was very well seasoned and flavorful. We had hot sauce, which was homemade and incredible hot! If you're not a fan of spicy or can only handle a mild amount, I advise caution with the hot sauce. This was a wonderful restaurant that I would definitely revisit if I'm in the area again.

Came here last week and had a great experience. Came here tonight and hostess was very rude, kept harassing me and when I asked her I'd she wanted my business she responded with no. Very disappointed because my previous experience was great. Won't be returning or recommending unless they reach out and confirm they've addressed their customer service issue.
I order lomo saltado just about every week. I love that dish and this place so so much.

The musics was too loud! The service was friendly but the kitchen was slow. We ordered a little bit of everything . The only thing I can say that was great was the corn on the cob, everything else needed more flavor. I would suggest using better rice for the Moro. Not a fan of this spot.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: The oxtails made my friend and I sick. Overall not worth the trip even though I wanted to like and support any business open 24/7 nowadays.

Ordered some food from here was curious to try something different I ordered a Cuban burger which sounded good also ordered a classic Cuban sandwich the burger had some good flavors but was very soggy and mushy real messy to eat want that enjoyable the Cuban sandwich on the other hand was still crispy and crunchy and packed tons of flavors
Decent food but horrible service. The service is unfriendly, poor, and rushed. They serve you how they want and not how you actually requested your food.

The place is very loud.  You can't heard what the servers are saying because of the loudest and he is rushing to go somewhere else.  Service is bare minimum,  we need to consistently wave to get water refill and take plates away.  The food was ok.  The presentation of the food was pretty but all the flavors was very similar.

Copellia has a diverse menu for anyone that you really go to at any time of day. A step up fro a diner. I had the huevos rancheros. It was very good. Service got a little slow towards the end, but in their defense it was a busy lunch hour.

If I could leave 0 stars I would. Went to dinner and the waiter spilled an entire glass of RED WINE on me. I tried to be nice about it but after the waiter just handed me a flan as an apology w/o asking if I even liked wanted it I was pissed. They clearly cared so little about their customers of color. Also the food was dry not at all tasty. NEVER GOING BACK AGAIN.

This Cuban place is UNREAL. First off it's open really late so it's good for all your post-bar munchies! They have reasonable prices and really quick service. And this place is very authentic, real-deal Cuban. Their guacamole was honestly some of the best I've ever had in my life. Literally scraped the bowl clean. And it comes with the authentic corn nachos And fried yuca chips, not tostitos from a bag. I also got the burger which was unbelievable, it had something crispy fried on top of it and I'm not even sure what it was but it was delicious! Will certainly be back soon!

We were in NY for an appt and needed somewhere to eat. After passing several restaurants we happened upon Coppelia. The food was served hot, tasted amazing and the service was excellent. I can't wait to visit NY again just for this food. We ordered the salmon, steak and egg, Brussel spouts, spinach and tomato and plantains....Amazing!!!

Service was exceptional! A group of us came in on a Saturday without a reservation around 9-10PM. They were able to seat us within 15 minutes and get out food out immediately. We were in a rush and they were able to accommodate our schedules.
Beautiful place!  Very Covid-safe and clean.  11 dollar burger, 2 dollars to add fries , 6 bucks for a draft, .75 to add bacon.  Everything was great, very cool environment.

Walked in with a party of 7 and they took us immediately during a very busy Saturday, so I can not complain (yet). It was packed, good energy, great music. But the wait for service was, well rude. The happy hour priced drinks, made up for the wait. Definitely the reason it was so packed, a good happy hour for sure. I was very pleased with my main course the salmon w/ purple potatoes, cooked just how I requested and very fresh. My friends all seemed happy as well with their meals until it was pay time. The waitress messed up our bills more then once. Hope they get her some help, meaning hire more staff for busy days!
Excellent. Love the lomo saltado. Nice staff and great food. The food was delicious I would eat it again.

Been craving a cubano sandwich for the longest. Saw the majority of good posts raving about the sandwich and they're right. It's honestly pretty good, I gave it four stars because I wish they'd put some more ham( next time I order I'll definitely be asking for that ) and also wished the French fries were better. The bread was perfectly toasted, pernil was seasoned and shredded well. A good amount of cheese, mustard and pickles. I definitely recommend trying their sandwich.

Boy have they gone downhill since opening. They served us stale plantain chips with bland guac, the steak dish was also not what it used to be and the pancakes were slightly burnt and dry. They are skimping big time on integrity and quality. Thankfully, there are plenty of other restaurants that have remained consistent over the years. Bye Coppelia!

Great good for good prices and nice service. Good atmosphere but a bit noisy. Not good for kids but everything else is fine, casual dates are good too. Walkable to bus stops and subway stations. Quite a few options for drinks and food. Do recommend and I'd definitely be going back sometime again
Yummy food. My favorite was the chile relleno stuffed with veggies. Great service. Will come again.

This is one of nyc's great late night food spots. So lively at nights. Great menu with wholesome courses. Would definitely recommend. This is one restaurant where I would come back constantly to try all their dishes.

My boyfriend has been wanting to come to this place for a while so we decided to give it a shot last night. I wasn't impressed. I was expecting Cuban food but it was nothing like I thought it would be. We shared the mac chicharrón for an app and it tasted like boxed Mac n cheese. I got the camarones Cienfuegos with rice and beans. The rice was extremely hard (nothing like Cuban rice) and the shrimp werent even cleaned out which was gross. The only thing I did enjoy was my capirinah drink. The manager was very welcoming and friendly, but the staff could be a little more attentive. After we got our food they never came back to check on us, but they were also a little busy so I'll assume that's why. This Place is open 24 hours so it's a cool place to go after a night out on the town. But if you're coming for some authentic food, this isn't your place.

Amazing chicken and rice.  My gf only eats gluten free and she had many options to choose from! This place is open 24/7...i repeat...it's always open! Annnnnnnd they have amazing food? What more can you ask for? The chicken and rice almost tastes like Chinese fried Rice but 10x better! I highly recommend coming here.  It's cute and cozy inside and I never had to wait for a table.  I was here a year ago and loved it! And I still do :) I will be back for sure!!!

I love this place to bits. The food is very good. I used to consider this my go to place around 14th st. Each time I visit however I am constantly reminded of how shoddy their service is though. You have to ask for anything multiple times and even ask multiple people. It is almost as if their wait staff is just lazy. Even to get the check, it takes them years. This one element of the coppelia experience is just putting off. More recently, their brunch menu, though delicious is just so minuscule in portion for the price! Even the hash de cost ills has 3 bits of meat with triple the quantity of potatoes - and even after that, the portion is just too small for the price.

!!! This establishment is racist! I came here with my son  and the manager refused to sit us suggesting we couldn't afford to pay. I love the food but this is ridiculous and I refuse to support a racist establishment
Good vibe... Open 24 hours. Good staff... Great food. This one of my favorite spots in New York City. They have a few veggie options that will workout for you if you're a veggie lover.

Coppelia was a decent spot. The perk is that it's open 24 hours so it is a good late night spot if you're hungry and in the area. It's not a huge space but big enough for you to feel comfortable. Service was decent. The food was good. There's a good variety of options depending on what you were in the mood for. I would definitely go back because it was convenient and open 24/7.

I used to live near this place.   I found myself in Chelsea again and this was my first stop.   Nothing has changed, the food it still outstanding.   I have so many favorite dishes here I can't list them all.   I ended up buying 3 dinners to reheat later.   All were wonderful.  Please support this local business, you won't regret it.

Pretty interesting dishes here, and I'm talking about that Mac & Chicharrón. I'm pretty sure it's not a Cuban dish being that I come from a Cuban family but the flavors blended well. I might not have it again but it's a dish I can say I've tried, well flavored cheese & the chicharrón gave it a smoky flavor in my option. I ended up getting the churrasco dish which came with congris and sweet plantains. Very filling, one serving can probably feed two people. The churrasco was cooked to perfection & was well seasoned. Read some reviews that it was salty, I had gotten the saltiness towards the very end of the strip. The rice was okay, tasted very restaurant and not really 'home'.. more of a box taste. I got crazy and tried two cocktails while I was here on happy hour time ($8). One was the Margarita Cubana which was okay, spicy & thick. Thick because it has tamarindo juice in it and it came as a surprise to try and take that down. Another drink I had which I enjoyed was the Guarapita, this was a better drink! The staff is attentive & friendly, the music was flowing. I'd come back & try the pernil everyone is talking about.

Pretty nice spot here. As a Cuban myself I had high expectations for the place and although it didn't exceed them it it didn't disappoint in the slightest bit. Ordered the huevos rancheros and medianoche sandwich which were both very good. Bread on the medianoche was excellent and the pork was pretty tender and flavorful. Only criticism I have to bestow is the slow service and the ambiance which could use a bit of a renovation. Overall would recommend for a small bite or brunch as this place has it all for those who are fans of Cuban cuisine!
Media noche doesn't seem right on brioche bun which is too soft a texture. The sandwich and sweet plantains were swimming in grease. Disappointed.

A coworker recommended me this place. Was going crazy trying to find good empanadas for a BBQ party. I ordered 40 empanadas my mistake was not just buy one and try it out. The chicken empanadas was sour and taste bad! Just my luck when one of my guess was eating one of the empanadas there was a worm between the chicken. My embarrassment was big enough to just not take empanadas and let all the other guess know about it. If not I would bring the empanadas and make a scene in the restaurant or call the health department. I hate to leave bag reviews in people Bussines specially now in this hard times. But if u go to Copellia make sure you verify your food ( specially the empanadas)

Got the ropa vieja and chicken with yellow rice and a mojito. The mojito was, by far, the best part of the meal and made the two entrees somewhat enjoyable. Otherwise, I wouldn't order of these dishes again, as the chicken with yellow rice had a strange, gamey taste to it and the shredded beef in the ropa dish was over salted.
My go-to orders are the Lomo Saltado, Shortrib Nachos and Oxtail empanada. This is one of my top 5 places. It's not only good but very affordable.

Finally, we have decided to try new dishes at this place and not our usuals which is always good. Their grilled shrimp for any of their salads are awesome, chicken quesadillas was ok because they used a big piece of grilled chicken breast instead of chopping it up into little pieces, fried calamari/octopus/shrimp was ok and I like octopus the most, the pork sandwich was no good but their Cuban sandwich we got last time was awesome. The only thing I don't like about that place is it's way too loud, we can't even have a decent conversation there. They are open 24/7

Came here for brunch with my girlfriends. It's a fun atmosphere but definitely gets packed! Our waiter was very attentive and humorous. All of our food was pretty good though the descriptions make it sound more scrumptious than is the reality. I ordered mango pancakes that only had unrippened pieces of mango sprinkled on top. However, the drinks were really good and we enjoyed the place overall. It's definitely worth checking it out if you're in a pickle or looking for something that's more budget friendly.

This is my number one favorite late-night spot in the city, although I do grab lunch and early dinner from here sometimes as well. I've never eaten anything at Coppelia that I did not love, whether it was breakfast food appetizers or dinner. I also really love the staff here particularly the security staff - they are super friendly do a great job and always make you feel welcome.

WOW. This was one of the most underwhelming experiences we've had. I got the lomo saltado and my friend got the arroz con pollo. We both got the freshly squeezed orange juice each and a side of yuca fries. The best thing there was the juice and even that was priced differently on the menu than we were charged (we were charged more). To begin with the atrocity, the rice in the lomo saltado was NOT cooked thoroughly. I felt as if I was chewing on straight grains. The meat was FULLLLL of fat. Every single piece had fat on it. The fries were disgustingly oily (you can see it in the photo) as if it was sitting in old oil until it was time to be served. My friends meal was okay at best but again, the rice was not cooked thoroughly. The entrees are not cheap either. Both dishes were $20 and $23 on their own. It was overall an extremely disappointing and frustrating experience. Please know what you're getting yourself into before going to a place where the food will just be as disappointing as the service. Never again.

Amazing cuban diner! The food is delicious, the prices are reasonable and the servers are very helpful and nice. I came here to try the churrasco but sadly it was very late at night and they had run out! I was disappointed and ordered some mexican enchiladas and did not expect much from it! Boy!!! Was i wrong!! The enchiladas were delicious and the rice and beans were amazing as well. As a cuban i have to say that i dont like very much beans that are not made by my abuela but these ones were super good! We ended up ordering nachos as an appetizer and we had to say they were one of the best nachos we have ever tried!!!!!! The ropa vieja is also delicious! They have a good variety of drinks as well. I was very full at the end of out visit but i had to try the dessert and wow i loved loved the chocolate mousse cake. I will definitely come back.

This store opens 24/7! Usually very packs with their happy hours from 4pm-7pm. I came here one day after work with a few of my friends. The service here was great, we didn't have to wait long for our table since we got there around 5pm. We each got an happy hour drink and I was pretty surprised by it. Usually happy hour drinks aren't that strong but this place blew my mind. I took a slip and I already taste all the alcohol that was mix in. I'll be definitely coming back here more often to try all their other drinks and food.

I'm not sure about this spot in the day but it's the BEST spot to go to after a night out. The food is delicious and comes out fast. The menu is extensive, and a full kitchen at any time of the day. The bathroom is also very cute for all you "bathroom pic girls" like myself :)

A cutesy somewhat retro aesthetic, and not too busy around 11am on a weekday. Prices are oh so good for brunch. My friend and I split the Eggs Benedict (around 10 bucks!) and the Arepas with chicken and avocado. Enjoyed the Benedict but the Arepas are 100% the way to go. So flavorful you'll definitely be wanting more so beware if you split. Highly recommend for a not-so-usual brunch.

I usually like Coppelia, the Cuban-fusion place on W. 14th, and I enjoy turning people on to them. Over the years I have brought large parties there. But sometimes - and I will admit, rarely--at Coppelia the wait staff needs lessons in human relating. This weekend, a thumb-headed older guy refused to give separate checks to our disparate group of couples. One check for two people, only you do it four times at our table. He refused. I observed that this decision could drive people away, but he persisted, So we ordered...but maybe he had already developed a 'tude toward us. Or he was just a good lawman but a bad waiter--he made at least four mistakes at our table. But he knew how to insist on restaurant "policy" This guy was old enough to maybe be an owner, and so I guess he can act badly when he wants to. I'll limit my Sunday visits, thanks to this guy
Great food and the atmosphere makes you feel like you're in Cuba or somewhere. Cuban Sandwich was great.
The huevos rancheros are delicious! This place is a lovely place to enjoy brunch, and the patio seating is a nice touch.

I liked this place very much and didn't realize it was open 24 hours . Food was tasty although a bit different than traditional Cuban food . They do have all the favorites. I tried the pollo a la plancha which was quite unique ( almost Cajun like ) and finished with the guava con queso .

OMGoodness! such Heavenly food! this place is amazing! i love trying new vegan/vegetarian places and even regular meat serving places WITH VEGETARIAN OPTIONS because let's face it, this is new york city and why exclude yourself (unless it's a dietary health issue). As a vegan that doesn't push my views on others ( i know what you're thinking, we are out there though lol) to taste real yummy food that isn't made out of soy or tofu or settling for fruit so you don't faint in the middle of the street- this is one of my those hail mary places. Listen I like superiority burger in the east vill but they have nothing on Coppelia's veggie burger!

Was recommended this place to try and the food was pretty good considering its $$ price. I only give it this rating and you may see other reviews similar to this was because of the 20% gratuity that gets added on if you are a party of 6 or more (you can also see it if you look at the pictures of the menu). We came in as a party of 5 and when the check came, they ended up adding that 20% gratuity onto the bill. I don't remember what excuse they said to even have us pay for it but we refused. We sat around figuring out what to do and the server ended up removing the tip from it to avoid the hassle. But why bother give it in the first place? If there was an update with the store, it should've been communicated through the servers and updated on the menu. I hope no one else has to go through this issue if they're just sliding in gratuity without letting their customers know. Would not recommend to anyone if they're going to get potentially scammed from this place.

This place should automatically get 4 stars off the bat cause it's open 24/7. Not many places are open all day and night. Also the food and the drinks here are great. I had the steak and eggs and the special drinks they make were really good. I have been coming here for about 2 years and I will continue to cone here at any time for the food and drinks.

I hAve been coming to Coppelia for years and can still only rave about it. It is fun, vibrant, trendy, has great drinks, delicious food and is open 24/7. So much better than a diner but not so upscale its unattenable. Located conveniently on 14th street this is a crowd and local favourite and attracts those from all walks of life. College parties, family diners, date nights, grub with friends- there's something for everyone.

Lovely ambiance.   Good prices.  Good food.  Our waiter was rough around the edges and seemed frustrated that he couldn't hear the customers very well.  He wasn't pleasant and we seemed to bother him when we needed something.  Other than this, I would say this was a 5 start place, but took away a star for service.

The most disrespectful door man on the face of the earth. Told us it would be a 30 minute wait and then accepted another group as walk ups without asking us for seating. When speaking to the manager it was apparent he didn't care about the quality of the clientele and allowed the horrible "bouncer" to run the restaurant. This is NOT a proper Manhattan restaurant and should never be considered for anyone in living in or visiting Manhattan.

The Oxtail Empanadas were so dang good I came here twice while on vacay. The empanadas are made of sweet plantain dough. You read that right, PLANTAIN. DOUGH. It was the perfect combination of sweet and salty, especially with the crema, queso fresco, pico de gallo, & salsa verde. I also really enjoyed the Spicy Kale. I enjoy spicy foods, and this had the perfect kick. I vowed to come here any & every time I'm in New York, from now on. It's open 24hours so this was the PERFECT meal after bar hopping/clubbing, or if you're looking for a late night snack.

Visiting New York, we stopped at Coppelia and were seated by a male waiter. two seconds later a female waitress came over and told me they were no longer seating because the kitchen was about to close. Fair enough, but then she went on to accuse me of lying that we were seated by another waiter. She actually told me she saw us seat ourselves. Outrageous! I was humiliated.  We have come to this restaurant many times before. It was our favorite place. We will NEVER go there again. The owners would do well to hire people who know how to act in a civil manner to their patrons!
Coppelia is a lively Cuban diner! It's loud, busy, and fun. Highly recommend their octopus& chorizo sandwich and mango tres leches cake!!

I hate diners. But this cuban one is the exception to the rule. I had the fish tacos and the Oxtail Empanada. Really tasty. The Guacamole is also really delicious, and the chips it comes with is a mix of plantains, potato chips etc. They have a great red sangria, and I left satisfied (and tipsy).
I like the atmosphere and it's convenience, but the food is just okay. And the waiter are very unfriendly.

This cute place called Coppelia is a Cuban diner style venue on 14th Street in Chelsea. It's a delightful lunch, brunch or dinner spot. The setting is fun and cozy and the food is delicious! My favorite for supper is Flautas de Pollo and a margarita. The jovial tone is fantastic for group parties.

Cuban Sandwich is best in the city hands down. Came here first time at a very weird hour in the middle of the morning after a big Rave party. Wasn't expecting much and was absolutely blown away at the quality, flavor and amazing staff. I go here as many times as my diet allows.  It's a treat and so are mojitos !!!

Coppelia + Grubhub = Incompetence defined.  After charging and confirming my order both via app and text, missing the delivery window they estimated and then delaying delivery by another half hour, an hour after the food was to arrive, I message Grubhub to be told the restaurant that accepted, charged and confirmed the order was not even open and never got my order - so why program the app to accept orders and lie about food being on the way, twice?!?!  Customers beware of incompetence by both brands.
Food is good but that's not what you go there for! You go here for great service and really friendly and welcoming staff.

I'll  give this placed 4 stars just because I have had only 3 items on the menus. We arrived around 3pm (April 13)on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon. We sat immediately by the window. Great view to people watch and watch the sun beam off your company's face... great atmosphere. The place was packed with good vibes. Food was hearty, with great flavor and totally filling.  My vieja ropa was so flavorful and tender...ahhhh it paired so well with the rice and beans. Our empanadas were unexpectedly delicious. Looking forward to returning

This is a kinda fancy diner style restaurant, they specialize in Mexican/South American food, open 24h. Be prepared that the place will be packed, even on a weekday evening. I arrived on a Thursday evening, and I had to wait for a seat although I was the only person dining. The ambience is extremely noisy, good for parties to hangout though. I ordered the Mac and cheese with fried pork, yucca fries and a dulce de leche milkshake. The milkshake came out pretty soon, it was quite good, it had a strong flavor of the dulce se leche. My food came out super slow though, and I was not impressed. The yucca fries were oily and stiff, there were at least some that were hard to chew. The Mac and cheese just tasted like store bought Mac and cheese but with some fried pork skin inside. Nothing special, yet all that is surely not diner price. It was a busy evening, the servers couldn't keep up with the pace although they were trying hard to tend to every customer

Definitely experienced better. I made the mistake of ordering a non latin dish on the pre fixe lunch menu and the poached eggs ham and home fries were all sub par. The poached eggs were overly cooked no runnyness at all. The benedicts sauce was cold and clumped up. Biscuit was dense dry and overly heavy. Home fries was probably the item to eat on here but there was a lack of the chimichuri sauce. Average service but was attentive. Good juices though as i had the soursop juice which was fresh. Will give this place one more try and this time not make the mistake of going non latin on the menu item choice to see if it deserves a better rating.

We come here all the time and it's always good, but recently we went for brunch and it was FANTASTIC. Everything was fresh and delicious. Plus they have a good amount of outdoor seating that's pleasant to eat at. I saw another review on here criticizing them for being "slow to adapt" to COVID restaurant life. 1) who has the nerve to criticize the restaurant industry right now??? like isn't the whole world just hanging on?? and 2) I disagree, I live around the corner and have been going here since they reopened and each step of the way they've kept safety of their employees and customers as the priority while still providing a good experience

Had a late brunch in here Saturday morning. It's a tiny little place that had an upbeat feel and was bustling like any other brunch service at local diner. The service was great as well as the energy because Mexico v. Korea was on the TV. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and a Bloody Mary. Both were deliciously spicy and filling and I would have ordered a second serving had I not had to return to work. A great place and I will return.

Not stoked about the fact that they have no vegan options. Not even soy milk for your coffee. What if you're lactose intolerant?! All restaurants should have at least some vegan options. Big fail for me.

Overall I have mixed feelings on this place.  I had theb3 arepas and while they were tasty, the portions were small and they were more like mini arepa sandwiches.  The extra $2.50 for chips without any salsa or guac seems pricey and there are no refills on the soda.  I'd say food was 3.5, service a 3.5, cleanliness a 3 and overall value a 3.  Not sure I would come b

I've been going here for about 2 years now, and each and every time the food, drinks, and service is AMAZING. I'm so glad they were able to reopen despite COVID-19 taking out a lot of small businesses and restaurants around NYC, and the slight increase in prices is a very small price to pay for having this staple in the neighborhood. The outdoor dining, though limited, is great! The spacing between tables, the plexiglass between others, and the staff wearing their PPE makes me feel safe while still being able to dine out. The menu is not as expansive as pre-COVID times but that is understandable, and there are still very many good options on the menu. The staff is so friendly, professional, and still fast on service. SIDE NOTE: If you're going to dine-out in the midst of a pandemic, 1. Tip the staff 18%+ and 2. don't make petty complaints - everyone is doing their best to get through this pandemic.

Oh my gosh. I came here for dinner tonight and I ordered an oxtail empanada to start before my meal. The empanada was really good, I've never had one before made with plantains, and I'm definitely going to be on the lookout for these on the menu for future Cuban restaurants I go to. But let me tell you about the Lomo Saltado. It was amazing. It was the perfect blend of flavors and different foods (rice, fries, meat and vegetables). And the meat just fell apart in my mouth when I was eating it, it was cooked so perfectly. I'm going to be thinking about this place for a long time, I'll definitely be back, next time I'm in Manhattan.

Came here with one of my friends for brunch. They were busy but we were able to find space pretty quickly at their bar. The food here is pretty decent and the atmosphere in general is bustling. A nice location for a quick brunch.
The food was fantastic! I got the nachos to start and the ropa vieja. Will definitely be back!
Great place for your middle of the night cravings or Sunday brunch with friends. If it wasn't so far away I would probably be a regular lol
I got my favorite dish from Coppelia - the Ropa Vieja - from their new takeout window.  It was as delicious as ever!
This was amazing. The Oaxaca cheese fondue sauce was epic!! Definitely recommend eating here!!

I cannot believe I didn't know about this place for so long! My coworkers and I ordered lunch one time from there and that's all it took! The food it so fresh and flavorful! I got a chance to visit their happy hour and it did not disappoint, their drinks a strong and tasty!

My go-to "diner" in NYC. It says, Cuban. Slightly Tex-Mex but with a NYC finesse. Good breakfast, brunch, and dinner place. Always packed but I never really waited long here. Staff is efficient and friendly.
We were hankering for some nachos late at night. Coppelia did the trick. Large portion of nachos. The guacamole is excellent. And the chicken soup is quite good.
First time here and everything was great!!! Food is to die for !!! Service was amazing. They also have happy hour until 7pm

This place is awesome!! Their indoor seating is adorable and their food is amazingggg! So authentic and flavorful, their nachos were made in house so they were freshly made to order. Delicious and would totally go back!

Our first time here and we'll be back! We started with empanadas, tostones and maduros, all were very good! The Cuban sandwich is amazing and the churrasco was my personal favorite! Do yourself a favor and save room for the churros!

Amazing amazing and more amazing. This is a late night spot that serves Cuban food. Highly recommend the Cuban sandwich! We also shared some empanadas which were also delicious. Great spot and great service!

Wonderful Cuban dinner with very tasty food. It will probably be packed when you go and there are no reservations, such I suggest going earlier in the day (we waited about half an hour for a table for two, but larger groups waited longer). Despite how crowded it is, the service is very prompt.

Cuban cuisine at its finest. Walked in and was able to be seated right away. I came here multiple times. The food is always great. And the pricing is very reasonable. They are open 24 hrs so if your ever in the mood for good food and there isn't anything good open just know this place is always available. I would most certainly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys good food without breaking the bank.

A quick update on my earlier negative review from 12/03/17. Not only did our waiter (named Nelson M.) read my review and subsequently send me a passive aggressive private message here on Yelp - which I find somewhat strange and unprofessional. But I just saw that extra tip was charged to the credit card after we signed and left - which is fraudulent and illegal. The amount they added was low so it's not a "big deal". But it's the principle. Not only is Coppelia a business with rude service, but it apparently allows waitstaff to tamper with signed credit card receipts and add extra tip to bills after the customers have left. Very disappointing behavior.

Here at Coppelia after along time , and still the same vibe and the attentive staff from door to the bar and been taking care of as usual, it's the place to be, with this wonderful bartender Luis Luna so charismatic and great guy like everyone else, thank you guys I'll be back with friends to celebrate friendship and much more.  Highly recommended...
Most incredible empanadas, highly recommended the oxtail couldn't believe the flavors. Staff is extremely welcoming! Top 3 restaurants in Chelsea for sure. 5 stars!
AWESOME LITTLE DROP IN spot. Good food and service not a long wait time and drinks are reasonably priced

I eat here at least once a week. Whenever I have friends in town, I bring them here. The wait staff is very kind, the food is delicious and well priced. My go too are the cubano sandwich, frita cubana sandwich and the pan con lechon sandwich. All are amazing and will leave you pleased. I'd skip the fries if you're ordering for pick up, because soggy fries are gross. They're not overly crispy to begin with but go great with the chipotle mayo

We shared a mix of starters, empanadas, Brussels sprouts and a spinach salad and Churasco main course.  Happy hour drinks were excellent.  I had a blended Gran Paloma with ice. The service was great, our server was Juan "Nino" Carlos. He recommended to us the most popular and his favorites.  This place is opened 24 hrs 7 days a week. Delicious! This is a happening place to go to ...
Really good place to enjoy some delicious empanadas. The white sangria is awesome. The French toast is a small order. You won't get full off of that. Sat at the bar and watched a World Cup game.
One of the best restaurants in NYC. Great atmosphere and food, all for a good price. I've come back multiple times, would recommend to anyone!
The crispy chicken sandwich is the best chicken sandwich I've ever had in my life. Fries? Outstanding. Sauces? Outstanding. Service? OutSTANDING. Happy we wondered across this little GEM.

Place is ok. Stuff is ok. Food is nothing special. I didn't like the presentation of the food. Also I was so hungry for Cuban food and they didn't have all classic Cuban dishes. Also they didn't have sweet plantains and mamey milk shake - must have things for Cuban place. Design inside is boring. Wouldn't recommend this place.

This charming diner is open 24/7 with lots of delicious options. Service moves quickly but I didn't feel rushed. I had the arepas breakfast (a sandwich with eggs and guacamole) which appeared small and I was glad I had some fried yucca (super crispy with a great ají) as well. My sister had the blue corn pancakes (I don't ever think I've seen that on a menu before) and they were hearty in a way that many pancakes aren't. This is a pretty unique, cozy spot and I will definitely be back to try some more foods.
Always liking it here @coppelianyc1   a happy place that will warm your hearts  and it's an easy walk to get #CafeConLech and #cubantoast  #eatlocal #nyceats
Love coming here any day of the week and, particularly late hours. Love the atmosphere, the food, the staff. Great cocktails and food. I am becoming a regular.

I got a Cuban sandwich to go. It was average. Nothing to brag home about. I also got the macaroni and cheese side. I think it was good, but you really don't get a lot for the price. If I was in the area, I would give it another try. Either these ratings are over hyped or I got the wrong thing.

They say "Speed kills!" And speed is exactly what you get at Coppelia. I sat at the bar, placed my order with a super friendly bartender named Walter, and was in and out, super satisfied, in no time. I had their chicken flautas (the first time I ever had flautas) and their lomo saltado and both of them were amazing. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for Hispanic food :)
Very popular spot. The sweet corn and cheese empanada and Cuban sandwich were good.
MM mmm this place is sooo good. Walked in thinking it was a regular diner and nope it is a Cuban spot. Oh-em-gee... delicious. Find this little spot in NY.
The pernil was well seasoned and yuca was soft. Arepas were tasty as well. I asked for ketchup and the waiter brought me six different kinds of sauces.

If I could give zero stars based on tonight, I would. Large table of complete assholes were at table nearby, screaming and yelling LOUDLY...if you want to make an ass of yourselves, rent a private dining room. Manager (term used loosely) did nothing.  Guess the table of idiots was more important than all the other diners in the area. Never coming here again.
This place was SO delicious (and well priced!). The ambiance was great and very COVID safe. The staff was so good to us, I highly recommend giving it a try!

Had the Alitas 100 Fuegos which were chocolate-chipotle chicken wings. I was interested in trying it out, but as probably expected, chocolate doesn't go with the buffalo sauce that well. Fortunately, the chocolate was very subtle. The alambre sandwich I ordered was a classic. Lots of tender steak and the peppers and onions were crispy and juiced with flavor.

After a short wait, our group was seated at two different tables (didn't have room for 8). Despite this, our waitress and the staff were amazing. I never had an empty water glass and each dish was authentic and flavorful. I never felt rushed to finish up and we had a great time. I wish I could have tried everything on the menu. However, 100% recommend the oxtail.

Sooooo disappointed! I've been coming to this place for plenty of times. I was telling my bf how good the mac and cheese was. So we ordered take out, which arrived extremely fast. We were so excited till we saw our food..... $11 mac and cheese for 3 bites?! It was in the tiniest container I have ever seen and only HALF full.  the oxtail empanadas are also a NO, does not even qualify to be an empanada.
I love the food here. The Lomo Saltado is my favorite along with the oxtail empanadas. The drinks are always on point and I'm glad they have been able to survive the pandemic.
My bestie and I enjoyed a literal smorgasbord, as we ordered several dishes to split. The food was amazing! The service was excellent! Give this gem a visit!

It was my first time back after not coming for a year. Did not have the best experience prior due to a certain employee. Me and the same group of friends decided to go back for dinner on Friday night, when we entered we spoke with the manager Karen who immediately remembered the situation we dealt with a year ago . Karen was very sincere and remorseful about everything that happened which we all appreciated , she and her employees gave us such a amazing experience and really took care of us there. The food there has always been amazing and delicious! So there was definitely no complaints there! But I just really wanted to give a huge shout out to Karen who showed impeccable customer service ! Dealing with someone like Karen is what makes a restaurant stand out and is what will drive me to recommend this place to everyone. Thank you Karen and all the employees at Coppelia!
Oxtail empanadas are freaking amazing! I am in love again! The food and service here are stellar. I wish I lived here in NYC to experience the great Cuban infusions.
The doorman is just so rude, lets in anyone he want to; no wait list. And mocks anyone he doesn't like.

Coppelia is a throw back diner with a Latin infused menu of popular restaurant offerings ... I enjoy the healthy options on the menu such as their Havana (Kale) Salad (add shrimp, chicken, etc.) and my fave drink from the bar is the Gran Paloma, which is all that. Since they're open 24hrs its even more enjoyable for breakfast or an early lunch when its not a madhouse like during dinner hours!

Charming Cuban diner that is open 24 hours! Went for brunch and was impressed with the food, decor, and service. The Hash de Costilla plate was small but had amazing ribs that truly melt in your mouth. The Huevos Rancheros is a classic breakfast dish that met my expectations. Stuffed French toast had a creamy sweet filling that leaves you stuffed. Enjoyed my meal with a cafe con leche but the bar area was quite also quite appealing with a fully stocked bar.

The most decent 24/7 restaurant I know around Manhattan, it's nice to know I can always count on this place for good food and decent service even if is 3 am, I work in hospitality and always work until late so I love it
The vueva a la vide is the best thing ever! Its basically a ceviche but with a tomato sauce base. So yummy !! Also there have empanadas made out of plantains. Out of this world!!!
Nighttime staff was very unwelcoming. Wonder if the owner knows how the bouncer? Host? treats people. Also, why is there a bouncer at a restaurant?
